Player History
Drafted in 2nd round, 42nd overall pick, by Boston (UBA) in 1971...
Traded from Boston (UBA) to Penn on 3/31/1971 (Going to PEN: RF M. Hebron. Going to PIL: 1B G. Cloutier)...
Injured on 6/24/1972 with a Bruised Ribs, out for 1-2 weeks...
Had first career hit (double) on 4/1/1974, off Ross Jones (Ash)...
Hit first career homerun on 5/12/1974, off James Pressnell (TRO)...
Won World Championship with Penn in 1974...
Won World Championship with Penn in 1975...
Won Player of the Week award on 7/28/1978, hitting .467 with 2 HR, 7 RBI...
Had 5 hits with 1 RBI against Diablo on 7/27/1979...
Drove in 6 runs against Halifax on 8/20/1979...
Signed as a free agent by Boston (UBA) on 2/15/1980 to a 3-year deal worth $1,500,000 per year...
Drove in 6 runs against Ashburn on 5/20/1984...
Injured on 9/18/1984 with a Inflamed Abdominal Muscle, out for one week...
Injured on 6/27/1985 with a Hyper Extended Knee, out for 1-2 weeks...
Signed as a free agent by Halifax on 2/2/1986 to a 4-year deal worth $1,231,200 per year...
Injured on 9/5/1986 with a Broken Nose, out for one week...
Traded from Halifax to New Jersey on 2/1/1987 (Going to HAL: 3B W. Albritton. Going to NJ: CF M. Hebron, 2B E. Hockman, P D. Martinez)...
Injured on 4/27/1987 with a Herniated Disc Back, out for 11 weeks...
